title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: brexit blow to leeds ' european capital of culture bid .
leeds 2023 : council to hold talks over blocked culture bid .
flood warnings remain in place in deluge hit yorkshire dales .
woman attacked with a hammer in bradford car-jacking .
prime minister and chancellor visit leeds college of building .
domestic violence campaigner praised in the commons .
calls for police inquiry over wakefield academies finances .
halifax piece hall scoops two historic england awards .
york and bradford to see christmas dr who first .

documents.title: police appeal for missing 16-year-old help
text: wiltshire police have asked the public to help them find a missing 16-year-old .
balin sadullah karin has not been seen since 12 october this year , when he told friends in swindon that he intended to travel to leeds .
officers now believe he may be in the london area .
balin was last seen wearing a khaki , shiny , padded bomber jacket , dark tracksuit bottoms and white trainers .
he is described as 5ft 1inch tall , of slim build , with black cropped hair .

documents.title: our top five stories today
text: that 's all from us for today , we 'll be back tomorrow from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
updates on breaking news will continue throughout the night , but before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :
see you tomorrow .

documents.title: brexit torpedoes uk 2023 culture plans
text: brexit torpedoes uk 2023 culture plans

documents.title: bradford 's doyle out for up to 12 weeks
text: bradford 's doyle out for up to 12 weeks

documents.title: watch : halifax piece hall - 'best historic building '
text: the uk 's only surviving 18th century cloth trading hall in halifax has been given two awards by historic england .
the grade i listed piece hall re-opened this year after a £ 19m restoration .
it 's been named overall uk winner at the historic england angel awards , as well as winning best rescue of an historic building .
here 's a look at it 's transformation :

documents.title: cullingworth schoolgirl takes the lead in world dog show
text: a cullingworth schoolgirl has returned from a dog show in leipzig with a set of rosettes .
author: Bradford Telegraph and Argus

documents.title: listen : 'we do n't want it to paralyse rotherham '
text: can rotherham ever move on from the child sexual exploitation scandal that dominated the headlines in the summer of 2014 ?
that was the question asked on bbc radio 4 's women 's hour during a discussion about reputations .
sue wyn spoke about the reaction that she gets every time she tells someone that she 's from the town :
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: blair thanks doncaster for support
text: blair thanks doncaster for support

documents.title: watch : house fire caused by dog biting phone battery
text: a house fire was started by a dog biting into a phone battery in leeds yesterday according to west yorkshire fire and rescue .
but how ?
just take a look at the video below :
house fire in # leeds yesterday was caused by a dog puncturing a mobile phone battery .
video with the risks
was the dog ok ?
the dog was perfectly fine no injuries
yay !
what the hell !
why ?
what 's the science ?
lithium batteries mate
just by puncturing ?
my iphone now terrifies me
this is why airlines are petrified if you lose your phone don the seat , then crush it by reclining it back
thermal runaway !
it 's the same problem with ecigs , and leaving your phone on charge under a pillow .
thats what the police should do to any phone drivers phone .
in a safe place of course
good grief , that 's terrifying , just from a phone battery .
omg

documents.title: breakingtwenty-one-year-old found dead at leeds flat
text: a 21-year-old man has died at flat in leeds this afternoon .
police say they were called to marlborough street at about 14:15 by ambulance crews after they attended a `` sudden death '' .
officers say the man was dead by the time paramedics arrived .
detectives say that enquiries are ongoing to find out how he died and that his death is n't being treated as sus

documents.title: listen : domestic violence campaigner praised in the commons
text: the speaker of the house of commons has paid tribute to a south yorkshire woman after she spoke in the palace of westminster about the murder of her two sons by their father .

claire throssell 's speech was part of an event organised by women 's aid demanding changes to the law to prevent unsafe child contact visits with perpetrators of domestic violence after her sons jack and paul sykes died when their father set fire to their house in penistone in 2014 .
john bercow told mps about the importance of her words :
the speaker 's comments came after the issue was raised by angela smith , the labour mp for penistone and stocksbridge :
we do have a commitment to bringing forward a domestic violence bill and it will be done as soon as possible . ''
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: cctv and e-fit released after woman attacked in her flat
text: detectives investigating an attempted serious sexual assault have released an e-fit and cctv images of a man they want to speak to .
on monday a 23-year-old woman was attacked in her home after a man followed her into the saxton flats complex , near the city centre .
she 'd just returned to the flats and spoken to a man briefly on the way in .
there was a knock on the door and it was the same man asking to use the toilet .
when he got inside , he grabbed her and attempted to sexually assault her - she fought him off and he ran from the building towards ellerby road .
thankfully we have not had any further incidents reported but we still need to identify and arrest this man at the earliest opportunity. ``

documents.title: leeds 2023 : city being used as 'bargaining chip '
text: as the dust settles after the announcement from the eu commission that no uk city will be european capital of culture in 2023 the question is being asked - why ?
a senior leeds council source told me : `` all the necessary checks were made with the eu before bidding .
it seems leeds is being used as brexit bargaining chip . ''
five places around the country have bid to hold the title in 2023 - leeds , dundee , nottingham , milton keynes and belfast/derry .
author: Richard Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Leeds

documents.title: fitzpatrick second after day one in hong kong
text: sheffield golfer matthew fitzpatrick is one shot off the lead after the opening day of the hong kong open , the first european tour event of the 2017-18 season .
the 23-year-old shot a four-under-par 66 earlier today , with a round that included three successive birdies .
however , bogeys at the first and fifth holes denied him the overnight lead , which is held by india 's ssp chawrasia .
fitzpatrick has won four european tour titles with his last success coming in the european masters in switzerland in september .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: travel update : seven miles of queues after accident
text: and as quick as that it 's all clear again .
but do n't be fooled into thinking that it 's all free flowing .
nope , there are just over seven miles of queues leading up to the place it happened
all lanes are clear on the # m62 w/b within j25 nr # brighouse following vehicles involved in a collision being moved to the h'shoulder for recovery by @ twitterid thanks for your patience
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel update : reports of problems on m62
text: it 's not a pleasant evening on the roads , this is not going to help :
be careful if you are planning on using the m62 .
there has been a 2 vehicle collision near j25 westbound .
we are en route to help .
# drivesafe
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: leeds united fans third most arrested in england
text: leeds united fans were the third most arrested group of football fans in england over the last year .
government data shows that the championship was the league with most arrests ( 455 ) .
but overall arrests have now fallen significantly over recent seasons , dropping from 3,089 in 2010-11 to 1,638 in 2016-17 .
the data shows that in the most recent season , violent and public disorder offences made up over half of arrests , while fans arrested for throwing missiles saw a significant jump from 59 to 91 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shale gas sites injunction continued
text: shale gas sites injunction continued

documents.title: listen : can you help a child this christmas ?
text: there 's a warehouse near the meadowhall shopping centre in sheffield that 's very busy right now getting ready for christmas and is appealing for your help .

each year operation christmas child sends shoe boxes full of presents to children around the world but as the festive period draws ever closer they need a hand filling and wrapping the gifts ready to be distributed across the globe in early december .
andrew tankard is the regional manager for the project and told me about the scheme :
if you want to volunteer then you need to head to units 2-3 on tyler street in wincobank between 10:00 and 15:00 every monday to saturday until saturday 3 december .
author: Jenny Eells
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: brexit halts leeds 2023 plans - mp 'extremely disappointed '
text: the european commission has cancelled the uk 's turn to host the european capital of culture after brexit , disappointing leeds ' bid to hold the title .
fabian hamilton is the labour mp for leeds north east , he said : `` i am extremely disappointed that the city 's bid to become the european city of culture has been thrown out . ''
he added `` i sincerely hope that the department for culture , media and sport works with organisers to ensure the bid is successfully launched . ''
the commission has said the uk will no longer be eligible to have a host city after it leaves the eu in 2019 .

documents.title: air museum move for amy johnson replica plane in hull
text: a replica of a plane flown by the first woman to fly solo from britain to australia is to be moved from hull 's paragon station to an air museum in north yorkshire .
the plane was created by inmates at hull prison earlier this year to honour amy johnson , who was born in the city and who completed her historic flight from london to darwin in 19 days in 1930 .
the ministry of justice says the replica is to be moved to the yorkshire air museum in elvington , north yorkshire , as there is no suitable location within hull due to the plane 's size .
the ministry says it 's `` delighted '' the plane , which was built to celebrate hull city of culture 2017 , has found a permanent home alongside other amy johnson exhibits at the aviation museum .
despite this , leonard brown , who designed the replica plane , says he 's disappointed it 's leaving hull :
i had the pleasure on thursday to meet her majesty the queen and show her the plane and speak to her about it , which was fantastic .
now we find out that it 's not ours and it 's going .
i am not pleased . ''
author: Anne-Marie Tasker
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: two arrests in rotherham attempted robbery investigation
text: detectives from south yorkshire police say they have arrested two people in the greater manchester area in connection with an investigation into an attempted robbery at a bank in rotherham earlier this week .
a man and a woman have been arrested on sus of kidnap and attempted robbery and are both currently in police custody .
we 're grateful for the support from the public and to those that have contacted police with information about this matter . ''

documents.title: doncaster 's williams out for four months
text: doncaster 's williams out for four months

documents.title: flood warning in yorkshire dales
text: the environment agency has issued a flood warning for the river swale in kirby wiske .
the caution means that flooding is expected and the warning has been issued following heavy rainfall overnight in the yorkshire dales .
water in that area is expected to reach a depth of three metres this afternoon and may rise up to a peak of four metres before midnight .
the warning is currently not classed as `` severe '' , so at present there 's no imminent danger to life but experts are continuing to monitor the weather across the north of england .
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: listen : local vet stars in animal show for kids
text: a vets practice in sheffield is one of the locations selected for a hit children 's show about animals on cbbc .
the pets factor follows four vets across the uk at their practices one of the stars is cat who works at peak vets in woodseats .
i 've been up there this morning to hear how it came about :
author: Jenny Eells
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: listen : scarborough hospital improves a & e waiting times
text: health bosses have been told waiting times at scarborough hospital 's accident and emergency department are going in the right direction .
in recent days all patients have been seen within the national target of four hours .
simon cox , is the chief officer at the scarborough and ryedale clinical commissioning group .
he says there have been changes to the way some patients are seen :

documents.title: yorkshire club in top 10 for banned fans in england and wales
text: barnsley fc find themselves on a list of ten football clubs with the most banned supporters across all four divisions of professional football in england and wales .
the reds are seventh on the list with 43 of their fans no longer allowed to attend matches .
however , overall the numbers of banning orders issued across the country has seen a sixth consecutive drop , down from 2,085 in 2015-16 to 1,929 last year .
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: leeds 2023 : mp says treatment of city 'shoddy '
text: the eu commission has written to the government to say that cities - including leeds - in the uk wo n't be eligible to be european capital of culture in 2023 because of brexit .
hilary benn , the mp for leeds central and the head of the commons select committee for leaving the eu said that the treatment of cities like leeds is `` shoddy '' .
in an interview on bbc radio leeds he said : `` this is a terrible blow and has come completely out of the blue - it 's particularly extraordinary especially as the bids have just gone in . ''
mr benn said : `` to wait until all the work had gone in and turn around and say you ca n't do this .
it 's shoddy treatment of leeds and the other cities that have worked so hard . ''
he added : `` whether anyone from the dcms asked the ( eu ) commission ( after the brexit vote ) i have no idea , but they knew the bids were coming , why wait until now ? ''

documents.title: breakingleeds 2023 : £ 1m spend on european capital of culture bid
text: leeds city council have confirmed that £ 1m had been spent on the leeds 2023 bid - £ 200,000 of public money and £ 800,000 from private investment .

documents.title: leeds 2023 culture decision : what it means for the cityanalysis
text: the fact that it seems leeds wo n't be able to bid to be european capital of culture in 2023 is a huge blow .
first there 's the economic side , liverpool is thought to have brought £ 750m into the economy far more than the tour de france grand depart in the city - simply put it 's a huge amount of money .
there 's real shock at this within the council and the government - nobody saw it coming .
the decision is very much about brexit with the referendum result putting leeds , and the other uk bidders , outside of the eu 's rules .

but one crumb of hope is that we do n't know what britain 's arrangements with the eu are going to be - it 's unlikely , but still possible , that britain could apply to join the european economic area which would put us back in the running .
top officials at leeds city council have told me they 're in urgent discussions this afternoon .
but to change the eu 's mind would take a massive climbdown , something which now it 's gone this far will be very difficult to do .
author: Richard Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Leeds

documents.title: flood warnings and alerts issued for yorkshire dales
text: flood warnings remain in place across parts of northern england following torrential rain that forced dozens of people from their homes .
in north yorkshire there 's a flood warning in place for the river swale at kirby wiske , where the water is expected to flood access roads from around 14:00 .
there are flood alerts on the river swale and river ure in the yorkshire dales .
a flood warning means flooding is imminent or occurring .
a flood alert means flooding is possible .
fire crews from bentham , settle and skipton responded to `` numerous flooding incidents '' in the ingleton and bentham area of north yorkshire late yesterday evening .
crews say they assisted more than 30 properties with pumping out water and diverting water flow .

documents.title: barnsley audience wanted for bbc 's question time
text: the bbc 's question time programme is coming to barnsley in december and the show is offering you the chance to be in the audience .
the panelists and the venue in the town are yet to be confirmed .
the debate hosted by david dimbleby will take place on thursday 14 december .
you can apply for tickets here and you 'll be informed later about the progress of your application .
author: Kevin Larkin
Political reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: listen : 'what reason have i got to be depressed ? '
text: shaun doane from the sheffield band the everly pregnant brothers has spoken to me about his mental health issues .
the singer has been living with illness for many years and has now started writing his own blog to help him battle the struggles .
he still often wonders why he suffers as he does :
author: Becky Measures
BBC Radio Sheffield presenter

documents.title: breakinggovernment 'deeply disappointed ' over culture decision
text: the department of digital , culture , media and sport ( dcms ) said it `` disagreed '' with the european commission 's decision to not allow uk cities - including leeds - to host the european capital of culture in 2023 .
a letter from the european commission to the dcms said uk participation `` would not be possible '' .
the dcms said it was `` deeply disappointed '' that the commission had waited until the uk cities had submitted their bids before `` communicating this new position to us '' .
the uk government said previously that the title was `` part of our plan for a dynamic , outward-looking and global britain '' post-brexit .
the dcms added `` we remain committed to working with the five uk cities and we are in urgent discussions with the commission on the matter . ''

documents.title: woman attacked with a hammer in bradford car-jacking
text: a woman was hit with a hammer during a car-jacking near morrisons ' headquarters in bradford yesterday .
it happened at about 17:10 on gain lane - where the supermarket chain has its head offices - when a woman in her 40s was getting in to her black nissan juke .
a masked man opened the passenger door and asked for her keys and she was hit on the hand with a hammer before the man climbed in to the driver 's seat and drove off .
police say the suspect is an asian , slim , around 5ft 10ins tall , in his late teens or early 20s and was wearing a black puffa jacket and had a thin black scarf covering part of his face .

documents.title: leeds 2023 : council to hold talks over blocked culture bid
text: the eu commission say that no uk cities will be able to host the european capital of culture - leeds had submitted its bid last month .
senior sources at leeds city council say talks are being held this afternoon to discuss the commission 's announcement .
the uk government said previously that the title was `` part of our plan for a dynamic , outward-looking and global britain '' post-brexit .

a spokeswoman for the european commission told bbc news : `` as one of the many concrete consequences of its decision to leave the european union by 29 march 2019 , the uk can not host the european capital of culture in 2023 .

`` according to the rules adopted by the european parliament and the council , this action is not open to third countries except candidate countries and european free trade association/european economic area countries . ''

documents.title: leeds 2023 : commission letter rules uk out of culture bid
text: leeds ' bid to be european capital of culture seems to be in tatters this lunchtime after a letter from the european commission to the government said the uk 's access will be `` would not be possible '' .
the leeds 2023 bid was expected to cost £ 62m and the city 's formal bid was submitted to the department for culture media and sport last month .
a development of the city 's south bank was also tied up in the bid - including construction of a lighthouse on the south bank and extending the two-day leeds night light festival .
leeds was competing against nottingham , dundee , milton keynes and belfast .

we are aware of a letter from the european commission regarding the cancellation of the european capital of culture competition for all uk bidding cities and are seeking urgent clarification from dcms .
this is an absolute joke ! !
it is the `` european capital of culture '' not the `` eu capital of culture '' .
we are the 2nd largest economy out of the 50 countries of europe , and of the 28/27 of the eu .
we love europe and are part of europe , just not part of the slow and cumbersome eu .
it receives eu funding
fine - rename it then ! !
to `` eu capital of culture '' how dare they pontificate on something they are only part of !
europe is more than the eu !
you wanted no part of the eu - the european capital of culture programme is very much integral to the eu 's cultural output .
i 'm not sure why exclusion from this is any different to any other aspect of brexit going forward .

we wanted no part of the bloated , inept , two parliament , expensive , head in ivory towers , can not negotiate deals with china , usa , japan etc - eu we will always want to be partners and close to europe and europeans !
rename it to `` eu capital of culture '' and there is no problem !
so in your view , the european union and european commission should not be allowed to use the word european in their cultural programming ?
oh lord , do brextremists want to take back control of the word europe now .
this is getting out of hand
what ?
how can the eu decide everyhthing for the whole of europe ?
the eu is not europe !
seriously .
you did n't see this coming ?
really ?
that 's just bad planning .
hi jonathan we have worked with dcms and the european commission throughout .
the commission even appointed a panel of judges we were due to meet next week and as such this has been a huge shock to all bidding cities
sure .
but you did have a bit in your plan with the heading `` risks '' and then an assessment of what might happen .
tell me you did .
of course our bid has always been just one part of our long term strategy to improve the quality of life in leeds , nevertheless today 's events are enormously disappointing
how can you apply for city of culture .
when we are leaving the eu bit daft
norway have had it before and they 're not in the eu
norway is an eea member .
the rules are clear .
well then , it 's a shame we 've lost it then .
being the way you are is n't going to solve anything
this is absolutely nuts !
culture does n't stop at borders !
why slap pro-europeans in the uk in the face ?
because somebody in the european commission 's culture division has got the imagination of a dead sheep ?
this decision must be challenged .
happy to help !
the european city of culture is open to eu members , eea/efta countries and any candidates to be one of these .
the uk does not fit these criteria any longer .
this would be eu money coming into the city .
that is , eu funding .
it simply does n't work .

yes i know all that - but before we get the rule books out , let 's remember rules can be changed , exceptions can be made and that culture transcends borders and that many people in the uk still self-identify as europeans .
i am pro-european - this is a gift to our opponents .
yes , i know all that , but this is an eu scheme using eu funding which aims to enhance a city and make it the centre of attention by bringing it lots more tourism and trade .
this is something so many ignored and now see what they have lost .
sure but you are focusing all the time on the money .
europe is much more than about money .
it is about culture and identity .
if you do n't want eu money to go to these cities , fine - but do n't take away opportunity for them to identify with europe .
that is not at all about money .
europe is much more than just money and this just proves it , in the same way the referendum proved much of the uk does n't look beyond economics .
the city of culture gives all the promotions and benefits the eu project is designed to , but it also is reliant on the financial aspect
if the uk has riled against eu funds for the arts , culture & infrastructure etc whilst we have been a member it does n't suddenly make sense to want that more than ever .
the money is important - we would be receiving funds while not being a member .

i agree with all of this , but we 're not talking about uk here , we 're talking about 5 cities that happen to be in the uk but that are about as far removed from the uk govt on this as it 's possible to be !
what about them and their communities ?
what can be done ?
we need imagination .

documents.title: breakingbrexit hits leeds ' european capital of culture bid
text: there are reports that brussels has said that britain will not be allowed to host the european capital of culture as planned in 2023 after brexit .
that 's despite the scheme being previously open to countries that are n't in the eu .

leeds city council said : `` we are aware of a letter from the european commission regarding the cancellation of the european capital of culture competition for all uk bidding cities and are seeking urgent clarification from dcms . ''
more to follow

documents.title: cctv released over rotherham burglary
text: south yorkshire police have released cctv images of a man who may have information relating to a burglary at dearne valley college in rotherham .
cash was stolen from a till in the canteen at the site in swinton at around 14:00 on tuesday 14 november .
police say if you recognise the man please call 101 .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: in an autumn morning across yorkshire
text: it 's a classic autumn morning across yorkshire so far and our bbc weather watchers have been out with their cameras capturing the best of what the white rose county has to offer .
first stop is huddersfield where this lovely snap was submitted at breakfast time :
it looks like a cloudy morning on the coast in north yorkshire where we 've received this photo of the beach at sandsend near whitby :
finally , here 's a great photo of the sunrise over the south yorkshire country side near rotherham :
remember anyone can sign-up to be a bbc weather watcher and you never know your photos could be appearing here or on the weather forecasts during bbc look north .

documents.title: prime minister and chancellor visit leeds
text: the prime minister and chancellor are visiting leeds college of building this morning following the autumn budget statement yesterday .
they 've been talking to students about the government 's house building plans for the future .
philip hammond says he hopes to prove the bleak economic forecasts released in his budget wrong .
the chancellor said clarity around brexit would increase consumer confidence and lead to higher growth in the economy .
but a new report has warned of the longest fall in people 's living standards since records began over 60 years ago .

documents.title: barnsley striker in car accident
text: barnsley fc 's tom bradshaw was involved in a car accident last night which has left the player with a bruised back .
i 've been told the welsh international is `` fine '' following the collision .
reds head coach paul heckingbottom said that his striker is `` not training today '' and that the `` club will assess him '' ahead of the yorkshire derby with leeds united at oakwell on saturday .
author: Jonathan Buchan
BBC Radio Sheffield Sport

documents.title: reports of explosion and damage to cash machine
text: there have been reports of an `` explosion '' in steeton near keighley - which has left a cash machine badly damaged .
police were called out to skipton road early this morning .
a car was reported driving away from the scene at speed .
nobody was injured .

documents.title: bradford man in running as 'social worker of the year '
text: a bradford mental health worker has been selected as a finalist in the social worker of the year awards 2017 , as a result of his `` outstanding work and lifelong achievements . ''
mark trewin ( has been nominated for the lifetime achievement award in the field of mental health social care by his team .
he 'll find out if he 's won at an awards ceremony in london on friday .

documents.title: listen : 'make mayor deal work for this region '
text: the government has denied that south yorkshire will miss out on a share of £ 850m to improve transport that was announced by the chancellor , philip hammond in yesterday 's budget .
however , the communities secretary sajid javid has confirmed that access to that figure wo n't be available until a mayor is elected for the region next may .
the problem with that of course is disagreements continue between the region 's councils as to whether it will be a south yorkshire mayor or a yorkshire-wide deal .
andrew deniff is the chief executive of the barnsley and rotherham chamber of commerce and his stance on the matter is clear :
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: kell brook announcement 'imminent '
text: the promoters of sheffield boxer kell brook have taken to social media to suggest that an announcement about the fighter 's future may be imminent :
special k has n't been in the ring since he lost his ibf world welterweight championship to errol spence junior at bramall lane in may
we 'll update you on this when we have more .
news soon @ twitterid

won the previous 36 and if you have seen it live there is no better ring walk .
talking the hardest ,
what happened to this news ?
hopefully a big fight at 154 .

author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: bramley baby : appeal to allow newborn to be 'laid to rest '
text: a mother whose newborn baby was abandoned outside a vicarage a year ago has been asked to come forward so her son can be `` laid to rest '' .
the baby boy was found in a tesco shopping bag outside st peter 's church in bramley , leeds on 23 november 2016 .
he was taken to hospital by ambulance but was later pronounced dead .
speaking directly to the mother on the anniversary of the discovery , police said they wanted her to have the `` opportunity to say goodbye properly '' .
the boy was found near the doorstep of the vicarage wrapped in a blue striped towel and a white 15in collar man 's shirt made by dunnes at about 09:00 gmt .
forensic examination of the shirt indicates it was being regularly worn by a female , officers said .

documents.title: police looking for barnsley man kenneth wilson
text: south yorkshire police are looking for kenneth wilson , who may now have travelled to the lancashire coast .
wilson , aged 49 and from royston in barnsley is wanted in connection with numerous offences including stalking and harassment , plus two counts of historical sexual offences .
any information can be passed on to the force by calling 999 or contacting crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555111 .
we have had a number of calls reporting that wilson could have possibly been seen in blackpool ''
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: listen : north yorkshire 'short changed ' by budget
text: social services in north yorkshire have heavily criticised yesterday 's budget and say they face the `` bleak prospect of further tough decisions '' .
north yorkshire county council says phillip hammond 's speech contained no immediate extra cash for adult social care and seems to offer no relief from what they say is `` relentless austerity . ''
conservative councillor , gareth dadd , is deputy leader of the council , he says north yorkshire is being short changed by the government :

documents.title: threat to hen harriers in north yorkshire a 'serious blow '
text: a tagged hen harrier bird has gone missing in north yorkshire prompting concern about its fate .

north yorkshire police have said : `` the loss of another juvenile hen harrier brings the total to six within 14 months across northern england - and is a serious blow to the small english hen harrier population .
john , a sub-adult bird , was fitted with a satellite tag in july 2016 by natural england when he fledged in northumberland .
his last recorded position was on 1 october in the threshfield moor area of north yorkshire , when the tag stopped transmitting .
police said no trace of the bird or equipment was found during searches .
natural england said john 's sudden disappearance was `` a matter of grave concern '' .
hen harriers , along with other birds of prey , are protected by uk law .

documents.title: 1st ashes test - close of play
text: sheffield 's joe root made just 15 as england reached 196/4 when bad light brought play to end on day one of the ashes in brisbane .
the england captain was out lbw to pat cummins in the evening session with former yorkshire player michael vaughan describing the delivery as `` magnificent bowling '' .
here 's the moment the wicket fell as described by the bbc 's cricket correspondent jonathan agnew :
day two at the gabba gets underway late tonight with ball-by-ball commentary of the match available via the bbc sport website .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: dozens of dales properties pumped out after heavy rain
text: fire crews from bentham , settle and skipton responded to `` numerous flooding incidents '' in the ingleton and bentham area of north yorkshire late yesterday evening .
crews say they assisted more than 30 properties with pumping out water and diverting water flow .
five cars were also stranded in flood water on the a65 south of ingleton in the yorkshire dales .

documents.title: calls for police inquiry over wakefield academies finances
text: councillors have called for a police investigation into the financial running of a collapsed academy chain .
wakefield city academies trust ( wcat ) announced in september it was giving up its 21 schools because it could not rapidly improve them .
during a wakefield council meeting it was claimed the trust moved millions of pounds of school reserves in to its centralised accounts prior to collapse .
leader peter box said he would be talking to police about his concerns .
the meeting of the full council heard how three schools in the district , which were run by the trust , face losing a total of £ 1.5m .

documents.title: post-budget chancellor visits leeds college of building
text: less than 24-hours after the government announced where it plans to spend its money over the coming months , the man controlling the purse strings is in leeds this morning .
the chancellor philip hammond is at the leeds college of building as part of a post-budget media tour .
the leeds college of building was established in 1960 and trains people for work in the construction industry .

documents.title: just desserts ? doncaster dinner lady is chef of the year
text: a dinner lady , or school chef as they are called now , from doncaster has been crowned the yorkshire and humber school chef of the year .
amanda phillips works at bentley high street primary school in the town , where each day she comes up with more than 300 school dinners .

in the competition she was required to produce a healthy , balanced two-course meal comprising of a main course and dessert that would appeal to 11-year-olds in school and cost no more than £ 1.30 per serving .
so , what was on the menu ?
she now goes on to compete against nine other regional champions in the national final , to be held in march .

documents.title: york and bradford to see christmas dr who first
text: doctor who fans in york and bradford are being given the chance to enjoy peter capaldi 's final moments as the time lord before anyone else ahead of this year 's christmas day special .
the episode is being toured across eight uk towns and cities next month , two of them in yorkshire .
a screening in york will take place at the guildhall on 15 december .
then , after a bit of space and time travel , it 'll appear at the old odeon in bradford , on 22 december .
this year 's doctor who christmas special , twice upon a time , sees peter capaldi joined by york-born david bradley , as the first doctor .
you can click here to find out about getting tickets .

documents.title: halifax piece hall scoops two historic england awards
text: the piece hall in halifax has been given two awards by historic england .
the grade i listed building re-opened this year after a £ 19m restoration .
it is the uk 's only surviving 18th century cloth trading hall and was once the centre of a global wool trade .
it 's been named overall uk winner at the historic england angel awards , as well as winning best rescue of an historic building .

documents.title: ann maguire murder : trying to 'learn and not blame '
text: the family of murdered west yorkshire teacher ann maguire say they 're still struggling to deal with what happened , despite an inquest into her death .
a jury returned a verdict of unlawful killing on ann maguire , who was stabbed repeatedly by pupil will cornick , at corpus christi college in leeds three years ago .
but it said there were missed opportunities to share and record information about cornick 's behaviour in the lead-up to the killing .
ann maguire 's husband don says it 's hard to move on :

documents.title: south yorkshire a1 northbound closed at j35
text: some early travel news in south yorkshire .
the a1 northbound lane is closed on the entry slip road , due to a broken down vehicle at j35 .
the road is expected to clear between 07:45 and 08:00 .

documents.title: vehicles recovered from flooded roads in yorkshire dales
text: north yorkshire police says a number of vehicles have been recovered from flood waters and a stretch of the a65 south of ingleton in the dales was closed following heavy rain and strong winds .
over in lancashire the fire and rescue service there says it has rescued more than 70 people .
most of the flood warnings in place are in the lancashire and cumbria areas .

documents.title: check your rail journey this morning
text: things appear to be running pretty smoothly on the rails across yorkshire so far this morning .

but heavy rain and strong winds are continuing to affect north west england , resulting in some train services being disrupted and flooding is affecting various locations across the northern network .
you can keep an eye on journeys by clicking on the links below .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on thursday 23 november 2017 .
we 'll be with you until 18:00 with all the latest news , weather , travel and sport updates from across yorkshire .
as the christmas lights appear to be on already in most of yorkshire 's towns and cities i thought we 'd start today with some rather impressive baubles .
these are currently hanging in york 's museum gardens .
if you have any festive photos you 'd like to share with the rest of yorkshire , you can send them in by simply clicking here .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
